content.title: Goa Tribal's Employment Generation Programme Scheme
content.details: The scheme 'Goa Tribal’s Employment Generation Programme Scheme' by the Department of Tribal Welfare, Government of Goa, is for educated unemployed individuals in the 18-45 years age group who are members of the tribal communities of Goa. The scheme provides a subsidy of 40% on the total loan amount i.e. 95% of the project cost. The loan is provided for activities such as Micro and Small Manufacturing Enterprises, Service Enterprises, and Trade Enterprises. The beneficiary is also provided with compulsory entrepreneurship training of up to 7 days.
benefits: Subsidy of 40% on the total loan amount
Compulsory entrepreneurship training of up to 7 days
Maximum project cost for Micro & Small Manufacturing Enterprises: ₹25 lakhs
Maximum working capital limit for Service Enterprises: 80%
Flexible repayment schedule of 60 to 120 EMIs
eligibility: The age of the applicant should be between 18 and 45 years.
The applicant should have passed Class 4th (relaxable for deserving cases).
The applicant should be a Member of the Tribal Community notified by the Government of Goa.
The applicant should not be a defaulter to any bank, financial institution, etc.
The applicant should have been a permanent resident of Goa for at least 15 years.
The eligible activities are Micro and small manufacturing enterprises, Service enterprises, and Trade Enterprises.
The non-eligible activities are Farming activities, tobacco products and red-category industries.
exclusions: Individuals who are defaulters to any bank, financial institution, etc are not eligible for this scheme.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should visit the Department of Tribal Welfare, Govt. of Goa, Shram Shakti Bhavan, 5th Floor, Patto, Panaji-Goa, - 403 001. They need to fill in the application form and submit it along with the required documents.
documents_required: Valid Caste Certificate from Competent Authority
Professional Driving licence, badge, and business assurance recommendation letter in case of loan for the vehicle
Bank pass book/s of existing accounts (borrower & guarantor)

faqs.question: Can applicants apply for assistance under this scheme for more than one type of business activity?
faqs.answer: The scheme allows applicants to apply for assistance for any one of the eligible business activity types: Micro and Small Manufacturing Enterprises, Service Enterprises, or Trade Enterprises.

faqs.question: What is the recovery process for loans under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Loans are recovered through various legal means, including arrears of land revenue and actions under the Public Money Recovery Act, Debt Recovery Tribunal (DRT), or other relevant Acts and rules.

faqs.question: Are there any provisions for extending the moratorium period for loan repayment?
faqs.answer: The moratorium period is flexible and determined at the discretion of GTEGP-TFC.

faqs.question: What are the types of activities or industries not eligible for assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Farming activities, tobacco products, and red-category industries are not eligible for financial assistance under this scheme.
